title: Record book of relief work for Civil War veterans and their families, 1866
rights: The organization that has made the Item available believes that the Item is in the Public Domain under the laws of the United States, but a determination was not made as to its copyright status under the copyright laws of other countries. The Item may not be in the Public Domain under the laws of other countries. Please refer to the organization that has made the Item available for more information.
subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865 | United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Women | United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Social aspects | United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Civilian relief | Charities--United States--History | Veterans--Employment--United States | Veterans--Services for--United States--Finance
description: This ledger includes a list of Civil War veterans and family members who received financial assistance. Each entry provides family information, including names, addresses, and justification for aid. Most cases are women whose husbands were discharged, injured, killed, or otherwise unable to support themselves. The creator of this ledger and how it came to the Union League Archives are unknown.
isPartOf: Union League Collections. Civil War. Other Civil War Papers.
